title: #MeTooPay - Why I'm leading 100 of Britain's top businesswomen in the battle to close the pay gap
text:
Enough is enough.

This week, over 100 women in leadership positions in British business, politics, the media, the arts and sport, including myself and Baroness Dido Harding, have come together to launch a new campaign to end wage discrimination.

Too many women are paid less than men for doing the same job.

Like many, we had hoped that changes to the law and commitments made by the country’s biggest organisations would solve the problem - but it’s clear progress has stalled.

The Telegraph’s reporting of the discrimination faced by Stacey Macken - a female banker at BNP Paribas, who won a £4 million sex discrimination claim - highlights the severe challenges faced by women across public and private...
